title: Basic functionality not here
comment: I hope it evolves beyond this point. It's slower than connecting straight through the browser and some buttons don't work.

title: Love diaspora
comment: But the application needs a serious update. It doesn't even work as before. Now it just shows the website. Update for 5 stars. 2012 was a long time ago.

title: Nice but incomplete !
comment: It's a good application, but not compled. Thank's for your work :-)

title: OK but needs improvement
comment: Installed on a Samsung Galaxy S4 mini, can't seem to be able to upload pictures from the phone gallery to the stream. Photo icon just does not respond. Also, the app does not appear in the "share to" options in the gallery. Otherwise, I see the stream, contacts, search function, etc.

title: Keep updating
comment: Needs more tlc .

title: Just a website viewer
comment: Yet another "app" that is little more than a window to a website, in this case your diaspora* pod of choice. It does the job, but there's really nothing worth saying about it.

title: Seeing notifications
comment: What is not very handy is that you can scroll the whole page left and right except for the notifications bar, which causes you not to be able to see what someone has commented on because that's off screen. You can see the names and whether they commented or liked, but what they liked or commented on exactly will remain a mistery. I thought maybe if I rotate my screen, but unfortunately the app doesn't rotate to landscape. Also I'm missing the share option, to be able to share pictures from your gallery

title: Useful, but buggy
comment: One of the most useful features of this app is the Android share function, which allows the user to easily share pretty much anything to Diaspora. Unfortunately this feature is incredibly buggy right now. Trying to share from many apps will simply create an empty post, with none of the content that was to be shared included. Others will include some content, but exclude critical information, like posting a link header without actually hotlinking it to the URL. Ironing out these problems would dramatically increase the usability of this app for myself as well as many other users, undoubtedly.

title: Streaming Loading
comment: I prefer that when the app is loading, the option to cancel it. Sometimes it is annoying.  For the rest, good!

title: Confusing app
comment: I use diaspora at home but this app wont allow me to sign in without hooking up on some sort of pod... I don't even know what a pod is and I didn't need to sign up for 1 to hook up my account through my computer. . This app should allow people to sign in with their username and password instead of signing up for some pod... this is so confusing. .. At this point this app is basically worthless to me now because I can't even sign in

title: Buggy
comment: Pros: Share shortcut, faster than web browser interface Cons: Text formatting. buggy, buttons are too small, buttons sometimes disappear, unable to zoom or download photos. Verdict: Needs work, but is still usable.

title: Good start
comment: This is a good solid start on a full web app for diaspora pods. What is lacking here, as in the mobile web interface is the ability to upload photos. Keep up the good work!  Steve

title: Nope
comment: Will not let me log on for love or money,

title: Love it so far

title: Works Well but needs scaling
comment: This app works Well in showing Diaspora in all its awesomeness including animation. It is a bit slow to load even with Wi-Fi. I Will like the next update have an ability to scale the Diaspora screen to minimise scrolling on the smartphone screen.

title: Nice layout, but can't post third party links
comment: Once signed in, the layout is nice and functional.   However, any attempt to post from a source like my6sense or News360 makes a blank post.
Great work so far. Some minor issues, but is alpha, so to be expected. Still better and lighter than Facebook app, so defintely useable/useful. Thx!

title: Love it.
comment: This app works great for me. I use Diaspora a lot more because of it. I like it more then the Diaspora website.

title: Good start
comment: I like it. Two things though: It can't do landscape and toggling from full to mobile view seems impossible; the "back to top" button gets in the way.
